comments.body: @cournape Looks like the bento script might need updating also.

@cournape Can you do this for bento? It's not clear to me the bento won't run without this, it just may not generate the optimized code.

Also see the changes in `setup_common.py`, although bento may already use that.
This version probably needs to go into the bento fix. @cournape I pinged you about these additions twice before, but I probably was not specific enough about the problem.
Did you intend a tuple here `(fn)`?

Hmm, looks like bscript is starting to bitrot.

```
    # TODO: add OPTIONAL_HEADERS, OPTIONAL_INTRINSICS and
    # OPTIONAL_GCC_ATTRIBUTES (see setup.py and gh-3766).  These are
    # performance optimizations for GCC.
```

It's already missing stuff. Adding the new stuff to `setup_common.py` would be a place to start, but looks like more needs to be done. Hmm, @cournape Why is `bscript` not `bscript.py`?

I'm beginning to think bento isn't worth worrying about until it comes up to speed. Might be worth adding `["__thread", "__declspec(thread)"]` to `setup_common.py` though, just as a start. What would be a good name for that list?
moved it into a common variable, OPTIONAL_VARIABLE_ATTRIBUTES, also renamed GCC_ATTRIBUTES to FUNCTION_ATTRIBUTES as not only gcc supports them
